newsitem.title: USA: Wounded Tennessee policeman who suddenly spoke dies.
newsitem.headline: Wounded Tennessee policeman who suddenly spoke dies.

text.p: A policeman who nearly died from a head wound then shocked his family a year ago when he suddenly recovered his speech after seven years of virtual silence, died on Tuesday, hospital officials said.
Gary Dockery, 43, was in a Chattanooga nursing home since his health and level of consciousness had declined in recent months.

Early last year, Dockery surprised his family and his doctors when he suddenly began speaking clearly after spending seven years in a semi-responsive state. Although not comatose, Dockery's brain damage left him with a limited ability to respond.
Surgeons had not expected Dockery to live more than a day after a robber's bullet split in two and pierced key areas of his brain.
But just as family members were making the decision on whether to cut off treatment from him for a case of pneumonia, Dockery's "awakening" brought hope and worldwide publicity.
Doctors suspected that a fever or some combination of medications triggered Dockery's temporary recovery, which lasted only a few days before he lapsed back into his previous state.
